cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: just west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north–northwest today, turning north-northeast on Wednesday and then accelerating up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of St. Marys River, GA to South Santee River, SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Bonita Beach FL to Ochlockonee River FL including Tampa Bay (Tropical Storm Warning); Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River FL (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast northward through Georgia, the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic, and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 25–35 mph with occasional gusts to around 40 mph possible late Thursday night into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally less than 3 ft MHHW) possible along the Delaware Bay and Atlantic back-bays
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with locally higher pockets possible could cause ponding and minor urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief, isolated tornadoes are possible as Elsa’s remnants pass; rough seas and dangerous rip currents likely Thursday-Friday
